Giga Drain is very good for recovering HP and is pretty strong, Sludge Bomb is
also very strong with a poison chance, Sleep Powder is surprisingly useful
even if it misses sometimes and then Dazzling Gleam and Shadow Ball are good
coverage.

Get the TM for Sludge Bomb from a collector in Dewford Hall, get the TM for
Dazzling Gleam on Route 123 and TM for Shadow ball in Mt. Pyre.

![](What%20is%20a%20good%20in-
game%20team%20for%20Omega%20Ruby%20and%20Alpha%20Sapphire%3F%20\(page%203\)%20-%20Poke%CC%81Base%20Poke%CC%81mon%20Answers_files/flygon.jpg)  
Flygon @ Dragon Fang  
Trait: Levitate

  * Dragon Claw 
  * Earthquake 
  * Rock Slide 
  * Steel Wing/U-Turn 

Despite Flygon being somewhat under powered, I had to put him in it. Dragon
Claw is pretty poweful and reliable, Earthquake does huge damage, Rock Slide
is great for coverage and the last moves are all for coverage.

![](What%20is%20a%20good%20in-
game%20team%20for%20Omega%20Ruby%20and%20Alpha%20Sapphire%3F%20\(page%203\)%20-%20Poke%CC%81Base%20Poke%CC%81mon%20Answers_files/sharpedo.jpg)
![](What%20is%20a%20good%20in-
game%20team%20for%20Omega%20Ruby%20and%20Alpha%20Sapphire%3F%20\(page%203\)%20-%20Poke%CC%81Base%20Poke%CC%81mon%20Answers_files/milotic.jpg)  
Sharpedo @ Sharpedonite  
Trait: Rough Skin > Tough Jaw

  * Surf/Waterfall 
  * Ice Fang 
  * Earthquake 
  * Crunch 

Surf and Waterfall are both required for progression so it's up to you which
one you want to use, but they are both very strong. Ice Fang and Earthquake
are excellent coverage and Crunch is a great STAB move.

Get the HM for Surf from Petalburg City after beating Norman and get the HM
for Waterfall as a reward for beating Wallace.  
Milotic @ Mystic Water  
Trait: Marvel Scale

  * Surf 
  * Ice Beam 
  * Recover 
  * Waterfall/Dive 

Feebas is a pain in the ass to catch and evolve, but the annoyance is well
worth it. Surf is necessary for progression and does a lot of damage, Ice Beam
is great coverage, Recover helps Milotic stay alive and with its bulk, it stay
up for a long lime and waterfall and Dive are needed for progression, so which
one you use is up to you.

Get HM Dive from Steven after beating Tate and Lisa.

Swampert @Rindo Berry

Breloom @Toxic Orb

Seed Bomb, Spore, for obvious reasons. Brick Break for a STAB Fighting-Type move and for Tate & Liza's annoying screens. Facade gets doubled to 140 base power because of the Toxic Orb and Poison Heal combo.

Yeah, I know, one of the internet's punching bags. Well, Delcatty is my favorite Pokemon and this is my team so yeah. Fake Out and Thunder Wave just to have fun. Double Edge and Play Rough for good offense.

YAY ME! :D

comments.content_original_markup:
Alright this is gonna be a long one but I believe it's a really great team. So I've played both Omega Ruby and Alpha Sapphire a couple of times and I've found a team that works extremely well overall both in game and competitively. Sorry, no pictures.

We'll start with BLAZIKEN. Personally one of my favorite starters of all time, and great for competitive play.
-Flare Blitz -> Best physical fire type move in the game unless you're bothered by the slight drawback of recoil. 

                    (Blaze kick is then an alternative)

-Sky Uppercut-> Good Fighting type move, gains Stab as well; Better than dynamicpunch in my opinion because the extra power isn't worth the fact that it never hits. 

                    (Brick Break is the alternative or even double kick if you wanna bypass sturdy ability)

-ThunderPunch-> This is your coverage move if for some reason you find yourself against a water type and don't have a grass or electric Pokemon
-Protect-> Useful move to scout what your opponents moves are and serves as a free turn to get one free speed boost off on its Mega
ITEM: Blazikenite

Next comes GYARADOS. Fantastic water type and it's fairly easy to acquire. Get an old rod in Dewford and go fish off the coast. Has a pretty standard Gyarados moveset but i'll explain just incase.
-Waterfall-> Possibly the best physical water type attack in my opinion plus it gains stab and serves as an HM.
(Aqua Tail could be an alternative if that's a preference)
-Ice Fang-> This is more of a filler move and works great against Drakes' dragon types except for kingdra. Learns it early on and fairly powerful and can cause flinching, or freeze them.
-Dragon Dance-> This is what makes Gyarados extremely dangerous. Drop one or two of these and he becomes a well rounded sweeper, being able to take out most types.
-Earthquake-> This is your coverage move against his main weakness, electric, but is also just a good move to have on your Pokemon.
DISCLAIMER: Only use gyarados against electric types or anything you suspect to have an electric move on if you have at least one dragon dance because a lot of electric type Pokemon are fast.
ITEM: Focus Sash

AGGRON comes in as the Physically defensive tank on this team. Only thing to really keep it away from are fighting and ground types as they are 4x effective. However, Aggron and his evolution line pretty can pretty much tank and work through most of the gyms such as Mauville's, Petalburg's, and Fortree's.
-Stone Edge-> Good stab attack that packs a lot of power. Only issue is that it may not hit when you really need it to due to its lower accuracy. If reliability is what you're looking for then just change it to rock slide.
-Heavy Slam-> Aggron is one of the heaviest Pokemon in the game. Plus heavy slam is steel so it gains stab.
-Earthquake-> once again a pretty good move to have and it just seems right.
-Iron Defense-> Honestly, Aggron already has a high defense stat, but if you throw up 2 or 3 of these, you will be able to shrug off even a close combat or an earthquake.
ITEM: Aggronite

Never mind Gallade, because there's already a fighting type, throw GARDEVOIR on there. Although I would highly recommend a Gallade on any team that needs a fighting type, Gardevoir has it's advantages. It serves as your strong fairy type and a good psychic type that makes this team fairly well rounded.
-Moonblast-> Stab and there's a chance it reduces Sp. Atk. by one stage. Overall just a great move
-Psychic-> Also stab and it takes care of those pesky poison types while also having a chance to reduce the targets' Sp. Def. stat by one stage.
-Shadow Ball-> Filler move that helps against other psychic types
-Calm Mind-> This turns Gardevoir into an all out boss. Even just one of these dials up Gardevoir's power and makes it an extremely lethal special attacker.
ITEM: Gardevoirite

RAICHU is the electric type on this team and adds a touch of speed other than Blaziken. Although Raichu is only available after you deal with Kyogre/Groudon, it levels up pretty quickly and if you use the PokeFinder to find one with thunderpunch, you're all set.
-ThunderPunch-> Obviously a great Physical electric move, better than spark in my opinion.
(This can be swapped for Wild Charge if you want your Raichu to pack a little extra punch at the price of recoil)
-Thunder Wave-> This is mainly for capturing Pokemon and slowing down any opponents that may still be faster than you.
-Brick Break-> Filler move and is just a good way to deal with Normal, Rock, or Dark Types.
-Agility-> Allows Raichu to become even faster.
ITEM: Light Ball

So I'm a firm believer that every great team needs a dragon type. That's just how I am. They're just overall strong Pokemon and can sweep whole teams if the opponent isn't careful. In this case the dragon type is none other than SALAMENCE. The moveset is fairly similar to my Dragonite's in generations 1 and 2.
-Dragon Dance-> Allows Salamence to get faster and pretty much sets him up for a sweep.
-Dragon Claw-> Great dragon move, gains stab, and in competitive, it's less likely that they switch into a fairy type because its much less predictable than outrage. But salamence can't even learn outrage so that's fine.
(Dragon Rush is the replacement if you want just a bit more power, but it's not always reliable as it has 75 accuracy.)
-Earthquake-> Coverage move. Gets rid of those rock types that it's weak too.
-Fire Fang-> Also a coverage move that, after a few dragon dance's, will destroy any ice type Pokemon.
ITEM: Salamencite

Well, that's my team and it has worked pretty well for me, in-game and competitively. Sorry it was a long post but I feel it would be best to justify the reasoning behind my choices. In-game I always try and use Hm Slaves so that way I dont have to waste a move slot for them. Just switch out the Pokemon(s) that are the least useful at the time of the game. Anyway, if anyone has any comments or suggestions to make I would be glad to hear them.

comments.content_original_markup:
This is a team I've been thinking of for quite some time now.

Blaziken

Moveset:
Blaze Kick
Brick Break
Fire Punch/Flamethrower
Rock Smash

Blaze Kick, Fire Punch and Flamethrower are strong STAB moves that can cause burns. You can pick what you want for the latter as Blaziken's physical and special attack are about equal. Brick Break is a good STAB move that can break through Light Screen and Reflect, and I find it much better than Jump Kick and High Jump Kick. Rock Smash is an HM, as well as a STAB move.

Gardevoir

Moveset:
Psychic
Moonblast
Draining Kiss
Magical Leaf

The first three are strong STAB moves with their own advantages: Psychic can weaken the enemy's special defense, Moonblast can weaken the enemy's special attack and Draining Kiss replenishes your health. Magical Leaf is compensation for the lack of a Grass type.

Swellow

Moveset:
Aerial Ace
Air Slash
Fly
Steel Wing

Aerial Ace and Air Slash are good STAB moves with their own advantages: Aerial Ace never misses and Air Slash can cause flinching. Fly is an HM, a strong STAB move, and on the turn you use it most attacks can't hit you. Steel Wing is coverage against Rock and Ice types.

Manectric

Moveset:
Thunder/Thunderbolt
Discharge
Thunder Fang
Strength

Thunder, Thunderbolt, Discharge and Thunder Fang are all strong STAB moves that can cause paralysis, with Thunder Fang being able to cause flinching. You can pick between Thunder and Thunderbolt, as Thunder is stronger and can be learned naturally, but Thunderbolt has better accuracy, and you can only get the TM for it from Wattson after catching or defeating Groudon(OR) or Kyogre(AS). Strength is an HM.

Sandslash

Moveset:
Bulldoze
Dig
Earthquake
Cut

The first three are all strong STAB moves with their own advantages: Bulldoze can slow the enemy down, Dig is an HM and on the turn you use it most attacks can't hit you, and Earthquake can hit underground enemies. Cut is an HM.

Sharpedo

Moveset:
Crunch
Surf
Waterfall
Ice Fang/Poison Fang

Crunch is a strong STAB move that can weaken the enemy's special defense. Surf and Waterfall are also strong STAB moves, as well as HMs. Ice Fang and Poison Fang are coverage moves that can cause flinching. You can either use Ice Fang just to cover against Grass types, as well as compensation for the lack of an Ice type, and can also cause freezing, or use Poison Fang as coverage for both Grass and Fairy types, as well as being able to cause poisoning.

Thanks for reading and tell me in the comments what you think of this team.

just to cover against Grass types, as well as compensation for the lack of an
Ice type, and can also cause freezing, or use Poison Fang as coverage for both
Grass and Fairy types, as well as being able to cause poisoning.

Thanks for reading and tell me in the comments what you think of this team.

comments.content_original_markup:
I'll do one for Torchic.

Blaziken @ Blazikenite
Ability:Blaze > Speed Boost
-Flare Blitz
-High Jump Kick
-Earthquake
-Rock Slide/Stone Edge/Brave Bird

I love Blaziken. Awesome Typing. Awesome Ability. Awesome Design.
Flare Blitz - Pretty much OHKO everything that doesn't resist it.
High Jump Kick - STAB but it's kinda risky. If you want you can keep Blaze Kick.
Earthquake - Great coverage.
Rock Slide/Stone Edge- Are great.Rock Slide has better accuracy but lower power,and Stone Edge hits hard but can miss. Both are coverage for Flying type.
Brave Bird - If you want to be very damaging. But you already have a recoil move. However,it's up to you.

Linoone
Ability-Pick Up
-Cut
-Strength
-Rock Smash
-Play Rough

Pick Up is a really awesome ability in-game.It can give you really good items like Balls,Escape Ropes when you're stuck in a cave or Potions. It has 3 HMs and Play Rough just cause I think it's a really good move and interesting for a Linoone. Just use a Hearth Scale to get Play Rough

Manectric @ Manectite
Static/Lighting Rod > Intimidate
-Thunderbolt
-Thunder Wave
-Volt Switch
-Flamethrower

Manectric is a great electric type in Hoenn. It covers Blaziken's Water weakness.
Thunderbolt-Main STAB move.Great move.
Volt Switch-Get out of sticky situations ans still do damage
Thunder Wave-This is mostly to catch Legendaries or Pokemon.

Gallade @ Galladite
Ability:Steadfast > Inner Focus
-Psycho Cut
-Close Combat/Brick Break
-Leaf Blade
-Night Slash/Hypnosis

comments.content_original_markup:
Here is my team as I traveled through the Hoe-nn league:


Swampert @ Sea Incense (I didn't have anything else to give it so lel :))))

  • Waterfall (HM given when defeating Wallace)
  • Power-Up Punch/Hammer Arm (TM at Mauville City Pokemart/move relearner)
  • Earthquake (TM at the bottom level at Seafloor Cavern)
  • Dive (HM given by Steven after defeating the Mossdeep City Gym)

Swampert, to my belief, is the second best of the trio. I never really liked Blaziken cause it looked weird so I stuck with Swampert. I didn't choose Mega-Swampert cause there are other better Mega Pokemon that could be used.


Breloom @ Big Root

  • Stun Spore
  • Cut (HM found in Rustboro City in the house with the Cut trees out front)
  • Drain Punch (Yes, I hunted for this with DexNav - egg move)
  • Seed Bomb

Provides coverage for Swampert, and it can blast through the Rock and Water gyms. And it is a good Pokemon to add onto a team and is overall pretty sweet. It looks so cute tho


Swellow @ Idk, maybe Flame Orb if you want to choose Facade

  • Steel Wing (TM from Granite Cave)
  • Quick Attack/Facade (Lvl up/Mauville City Pokemart)
  • Fly/Brave Bird
  • U-Turn

Mainly got Swellow for a flier, but I guess you can use it.

Or the alternate option:
__

Or the alternate option:


Tornadus-Therian Forme @ Amulet Coin (nothing else to give it lol) (obtainable after you get the Eon Flute, and have a Castform in your team in Omega Ruby)

  • U-Turn (TM found on one of the Mauville Hills apartment balconies)
  • Thief/Crunch (TM from a Magma Grunt in the Oceanic Museum (I think) in Slateport City)
  • Fly (HM given by your rival on Route 119, just before Fortree City)
  • Focus Blast (Lilycove City Department Store)

This dood is pretty good on my team. Well, duh, he is a legendary, so I replaced my Swellow with him. Also, I never like to have 2 of the same type, so if it is pure Flying-type then it would let me have the last Pokemon on my team on my team.


Mawile @ Mawilite

  • Rock Smash (HM given after you defeat Wally in front of the Mauville City Gym)
  • Fire Fang (egg move or hunted by DexNav)
  • Play Rough
  • Iron Head

One of the best Pokemon on my team with Sheer Force shreking through everything.


Latios @ Latiosite

  • Surf (HM given after you defeat the Petalburg City Gym)
  • Psychic
  • Dragon Pulse
  • Thunderbolt (TM given after you check out New Mauville for Wattson (after the storyline with Groudon/Kyogre)

He was pretty hard to train at first, being measly Lvl30 when my Pokemon were around Lvl45. But, at the end he was a great addition to the team.


Lopunny (Buns Hun) @ Lopunnite

  • Thunder Punch (egg move, search with DexNav in Safari Zone for Buneary)
  • Return (TM given by a man in Pacifilog Town with two marills in his house)
  • Jump Kick
  • Strength (HM given by your rival on Route 112)

Kick ass with Scrappy Jump Kick and Return. That STAB tho. ooooooo

That is the team I use/used.
I never like using an HM slave on the team, so I like to distribute the HMs amongst my team.

comments.content_original_markup:
This team would be best for Omega Ruby, as Swampert can destroy most of their mons and you can only get Seedot in this version.

Move Deleter - In Lilycove City in the house EAST of the Department Store.
Move Relearner - In Fallarbor town on the western side.

1st Pokemon

Your Starter
Swampert @Swampertite
• Earthquake
• Rock Slide
• Waterfall
• Surf

Surf is for how often you have to surf around Hoenn. Rock Slide is learned at level 28 by Marshtomp and provides excellent coverage. (I used Rock Tomb until it learned Rock Slide) Waterfall is an excellent physical stab move and allows you to get through the last part of the game. Earthquake is a nice base 100, 150 with stab which hits like a truck. The TM for it is located in Seafloor Cavern. This video should help. I taught it Dive over Earthquake and when the time for the E4 came I went to the move deleter and got rid of Dive for Earthquake.

2nd Pokemon

Shiftry @Miracle Seed (Location)
Located in Omega Ruby on Route 102 as a Seedot.
• Dark Pulse
• Leaf Storm
• Leaf Blade
• Nasty Plot

Dark Pulse is excellent STAB and hits very hard. It is found in the Team Aqua/Magma base. Here is a video to help. At level 24, Nuzleaf learns Feint Attack. I recommend keeping this on until you gain access to Dark Pulse. Leaf Storm is learned at level 49 by Shiftry. Leaf Blade is learned at level 28 by Nuzleaf. I would recommend using Razor Leaf, learned at level 14 by Nuzleaf, until it learns Leaf Blade. I would recommend evolving Nuzleaf immediately after it learns Leaf Blade, as you really don't miss out on any good moves besides maybe Extrasensory at level 49. There is a multitude of ways to get a leaf stone. Personally, I traded the one from XY to ORAS as soon as possible. This link shows you where to find/obtain a leaf stone in ORAS. Nasty Plot is learned via the move relearner which costs one Heartscale.

Other Potential Grass Types:

Cacturne @Miracle Seed
Located as a Cacnea in Route 111, the desert.

Moveset
• Swords Dance
• Needle Arm/Energy Ball
• Feint Attack/Dark Pulse
• Seed Bomb/Nasty Plot

Swords Dance is obtained in Lavaridge town by talking to the Dojo guy outside of the Poke Center. You must answer "No" to his question. Needle Arm and Energy Ball are both level up moves, with Energy Ball being learned by Cacturne at level 44 and Needle Arm being learned by Cacnea at level 16. This means you may have to go to the move relearner to teach it Needle Arm. Feint Attack is learned by Cacnea at level 19, which means it should already know it when you catch it. Dark Pulse is a TM. Seed Bomb is an Egg Move, which requires Cacnea to be DexNav'd for. Same for Nasty Plot.


Roserade @Miracle Seed
Found on Route 117 (left of Mauville) as a Roselia

Moveset
• Giga Drain
• Sludge Bomb
• Leaf Storm
• Shadow Ball

Giga Drain is learned by Roselia at level 25. Sludge Bomb is a TM which is obtained in Dewford Town. This video should help. You can 100% get it before the E4 though. Leaf Storm is an Egg Move which will require you to DexNav for Roselia. Shadow Ball is a TM found in Mt. Pyre. This video should help.


Breloom @Miracle Seed
Located in Petalburg Woods as a Shroomish.

Moveset
• Mach Punch
• Seed Bomb
• Sky Uppercut
• Rock Slide/Stone Edge

Mach Punch is learned at level 23 by Breloom. Seed Bomb is learned at level 44 by Breloom. Sky Uppercut is learned at level 39 by Breloom. Rock Slide and Stone Edge boils down to preference. They are both TM's. Rock Slide is obtained on Route 133. This video should help. Stone Edge is obtained in Lilycove's Department Store for 30,000. This video should help.


Vileplume @Miracle Seed
Located earliest on Route 110 as Oddish.

Moveset
• Giga Drain
• Sludge Bomb
• Petal Dance
• Sleep Powder

Giga Drain is learned by Gloom at level 34. Sludge Bomb is a TM. Petal Dance is learned by Vileplume at level 59. Sleep Powder is learned at level 15 by Oddish.

3rd Pokemon

Grumpig @Rocky Helmet (Location)
Located in the Jagged Pass as a Spoink.
• Calm Mind
• Psychic
• Power Gem
• Shadow Ball

Calm Mind is for setting up and to boost its already insane special defense to maximum levels, and to allow it to hit like a truck. It is a TM obtained after beating Tate & Liza in Mossdeep City. I had Psybeam on until I got this. Psychic is a TM obtained in Ever Grande City. This video should help. Before Psychic, I had Grass Knot on it, which is a TM obtained behind the Fortree Gym. This video should help. This was huge coverage. Power Gem is learned by Spoink at level 29. Shadow ball is a TM, and helps against ghost types immensely.

4th Pokemon

Skarmory @Hard Stone (Rock Smash Rocks on Route 111)
• Sky Attack
• Fly
• Steel Wing
• Rock Tomb/Rock Slide

Sky Attack is an Egg Move and requires you to DexNav for it. Hits EXTREMELY hard. Fly is a HM. Mainly here for utility and a secondary flying STAB. Steel Wing is a TM obtained from Steven very early in the game. It provides very powerful STAB and hits hard. Rock Tomb is a TM obtained from beating Roxanne's gym in Rustboro City. It gives Skarmory some coverage and does decent damage. You can eventually teach it Rock Slide. Hard Stone is there to power up its rock type moves.

Other Potential Flying Types:


Togekiss
Obtained as an Egg in Lavaridge Town after beating Primal Kyogre/Groudon. Talk to the old woman next to the Pokemon Center.
Moveset
• Fly
• Air Slash
• Aura Sphere
• Dazzling Gleam

Fly is there purely for the utility. Air Slash and Aura Sphere are learned after taking Togekiss to the move relearner. Dazzling Gleam is a TM obtained after talking to a little girl on Route 123. This video should help.
It may be a challenge to raise, but once it becomes a Togekiss you better believe it will put in work.


Crobat
Obtained in Granite Cave as a Zubat.

Moveset
• Fly
• Cross Poison
• X-Scissor
• Acrobatics/Brave Bird

Acrobatics hits like a truck without an item, and STAB makes it hit even harder. It is learned at level 35 by Crobat. Brave Bird is an option, but requires you to DexNav Zubat, as it is an Egg Move. It comes down to preference. Cross Poison is a Poison STAB move and is extremely strong. You must bring Crobat to the move relearner for it to learn Cross Poison. X-Scissor is there for Coverage. It is a TM obtained in Victory Road. This video should help. Fly is there for the utility and possible second Flying STAB.

5th Pokemon

Ninetales @Charcoal (Location)
Obtained as a Vulpix at Mt. Pyre.
• Flamethrower
• Nasty Plot
• Extrasensory
• Dark Pulse

Flamethrower is learned at level 36 by Vulpix. A must have STAB for any special fire type, it does its job very well. it is recommended to evolve Vulpix as soon as it learns this, as you don't miss out on too many good moves. The Fire Stone is located in the Fiery Path, but requires the use of Strength. This video should help. Nasty Plot requires you to bring Ninetales to the move relearner in order for it to learn it. This move provides you with a powerful sweeping capability. If you DexNav for a Hidden Ability Vulpix (Drought) then you have an offensive monster on your team. Extrasensory is learned at level 31 by Vulpix. This is basic coverage and hits hard. Dark Pulse is a TM. Even more coverage.

Other Potential Fire Types:


Macargo @Charcoal
Located in the Fiery Path as a Slugma.

Moveset
• Ancient Power
• Flamethrower
• Lave Plume
• Earth Power

Ancient Power is learned by Slugma at level 22. Flamethrower is learned by Macargo at level 54. It is also a TM in Victory Road. This video should help. Lava Plume is learned by Slugma at level 34. Earth Power is learned by Macargo at level 58, but is also an Egg Move. This means you can DexNav for a Slugma that knows Earth Power.


Camerupt @Charcoal
Located on Route 112 as a Numel.

Moveset
• Earth Power
• Lava Plume
• Earthquake
• Rock Slide

Earth Power is learned by Numel at level 26. Lava Plume is learned by Numel at level 22. Earthquake is learned by Camerupt at level 46. Rock Slide is learned by Camerupt at level 33.


Torkoal @Charcoal
Located in the Fiery Path.

Moveset
• Heat Wave
• Sludge Bomb
• Flame Thrower
• Earthquake

Heat Wave is learned by Torkoal at level 55. Sludge Bomb is a TM. Flamethrower is learned by Torkoal at level 28. Earthquake is a TM.

6th Pokemon
Normally, I choose a Pokemon that I really love as the last slot. This time it was one of my faves,

Seviper @Life Orb (DexNav Absol and use Thief)
• Poison Jab
• Sludge Wave
• Crunch
• Coil/Flamethrower

Poison Jab is a strong physical STAB move that is supported by Coil. It hits so hard and is a great move. It is learned by Seviper at level 34 Sludge Wave is, in my opion, better for Seviper in-game. The base 100 offenses need all the boosts they can get. It is a TM located on Route 132. This video should help. Crunch is good coverage and really powerful. It is learned by Seviper at level 40. Coil is a great set up move and is learned at level 46 by Seviper. Flamethrower is a TM that Seviper can learn, and offers more coverage. It is located in Victory Road. This video should help.

And that's it! That was my team in game. I offered some replacements in case people preferred different mons or wanted more options.

Dark Pulse is excellent STAB and hits very hard. It is found in the Team
Aqua/Magma base. [ Here is a video to help.
](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=G6YWkANmTAo) At level 24, Nuzleaf learns
Feint Attack. I recommend keeping this on until you gain access to Dark Pulse.
Leaf Storm is learned at level 49 by Shiftry. Leaf Blade is learned at level
28 by Nuzleaf. I would recommend using Razor Leaf, learned at level 14 by
Nuzleaf, until it learns Leaf Blade. I would recommend evolving Nuzleaf
immediately after it learns Leaf Blade, as you really don't miss out on any
good moves besides maybe Extrasensory at level 49. There is a multitude of
ways to get a leaf stone. Personally, I traded the one from XY to ORAS as soon
as possible. [ This link shows you where to find/obtain a leaf stone in ORAS.
](https://pokemondb.net/pokebase/283216/where-is-the-leaf-stone-in-omega-ruby)
Nasty Plot is learned via the move relearner which costs one Heartscale.

Other Potential Grass Types:  
![](What%20is%20a%20good%20in-
game%20team%20for%20Omega%20Ruby%20and%20Alpha%20Sapphire%3F%20\(page%203\)%20-%20Poke%CC%81Base%20Poke%CC%81mon%20Answers_files/250px-332Cacturne.png)

Cacturne @Miracle Seed  
Located as a Cacnea in Route 111, the desert.

Moveset  
• Swords Dance  
• Needle Arm/Energy Ball  
• Feint Attack/Dark Pulse  
• Seed Bomb/Nasty Plot

Swords Dance is obtained in Lavaridge town by talking to the Dojo guy outside
of the Poke Center. You must answer "No" to his question. Needle Arm and
Energy Ball are both level up moves, with Energy Ball being learned by
Cacturne at level 44 and Needle Arm being learned by Cacnea at level 16. This
means you may have to go to the move relearner to teach it Needle Arm. Feint
Attack is learned by Cacnea at level 19, which means it should already know it
when you catch it. Dark Pulse is a TM. Seed Bomb is an Egg Move, which
requires Cacnea to be DexNav'd for. Same for Nasty Plot.

![](What%20is%20a%20good%20in-
game%20team%20for%20Omega%20Ruby%20and%20Alpha%20Sapphire%3F%20\(page%203\)%20-%20Poke%CC%81Base%20Poke%CC%81mon%20Answers_files/250px-407Roserade.png)  
Roserade @Miracle Seed  
Found on Route 117 (left of Mauville) as a Roselia

Moveset  
• Giga Drain  
• Sludge Bomb  
• Leaf Storm  
• Shadow Ball

Giga Drain is learned by Roselia at level 25. Sludge Bomb is a TM which is
obtained in Dewford Town. [ This video should help.
](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WO_dp5sb8CQ) You can 100% get it before the
E4 though. Leaf Storm is an Egg Move which will require you to DexNav for
Roselia. Shadow Ball is a TM found in Mt. Pyre. [ This video should help.
](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=v9XrlzSa7BM)

![](What%20is%20a%20good%20in-
game%20team%20for%20Omega%20Ruby%20and%20Alpha%20Sapphire%3F%20\(page%203\)%20-%20Poke%CC%81Base%20Poke%CC%81mon%20Answers_files/250px-286Breloom.png)  
Breloom @Miracle Seed  
Located in Petalburg Woods as a Shroomish.

Moveset  
• Mach Punch  
• Seed Bomb  
• Sky Uppercut  
• Rock Slide/Stone Edge

Mach Punch is learned at level 23 by Breloom. Seed Bomb is learned at level 44
by Breloom. Sky Uppercut is learned at level 39 by Breloom. Rock Slide and
Stone Edge boils down to preference. They are both TM's. Rock Slide is
obtained on Route 133. [ This video should help.
](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jgW9DrksLSc) Stone Edge is obtained in
Lilycove's Department Store for ![](What%20is%20a%20good%20in-
game%20team%20for%20Omega%20Ruby%20and%20Alpha%20Sapphire%3F%20\(page%203\)%20-%20Poke%CC%81Base%20Poke%CC%81mon%20Answers_files/PokmonDollar.png)
30,000. [ This video should help.
](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=E6vH053aNfw)

![](What%20is%20a%20good%20in-
game%20team%20for%20Omega%20Ruby%20and%20Alpha%20Sapphire%3F%20\(page%203\)%20-%20Poke%CC%81Base%20Poke%CC%81mon%20Answers_files/250px-045Vileplume.png)  
Vileplume @Miracle Seed  
Located earliest on Route 110 as Oddish.

Moveset  
• Giga Drain  
• Sludge Bomb  
• Petal Dance  
• Sleep Powder

Giga Drain is learned by Gloom at level 34. Sludge Bomb is a TM. Petal Dance
is learned by Vileplume at level 59. Sleep Powder is learned at level 15 by
Oddish.

**3rd Pokemon**  
![](What%20is%20a%20good%20in-
game%20team%20for%20Omega%20Ruby%20and%20Alpha%20Sapphire%3F%20\(page%203\)%20-%20Poke%CC%81Base%20Poke%CC%81mon%20Answers_files/250px-326Grumpig.png)  
Grumpig @Rocky Helmet [ (Location)
](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=G-rnPKEOQPk)  
Located in the Jagged Pass as a Spoink.  
• Calm Mind  
• Psychic  
• Power Gem  
• Shadow Ball

Calm Mind is for setting up and to boost its already insane special defense to
maximum levels, and to allow it to hit like a truck. It is a TM obtained after
beating Tate  & Liza in Mossdeep City. I had Psybeam on until I got this.
Psychic is a TM obtained in Ever Grande City. [ This video should help.
](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7GqltT2EMjE) Before Psychic, I had Grass
Knot on it, which is a TM obtained behind the Fortree Gym. [ This video should
help. ](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=InRzsuiYz5w) This was huge coverage.
Power Gem is learned by Spoink at level 29. Shadow ball is a TM, and helps
against ghost types immensely.

**4th Pokemon**  
![](What%20is%20a%20good%20in-
game%20team%20for%20Omega%20Ruby%20and%20Alpha%20Sapphire%3F%20\(page%203\)%20-%20Poke%CC%81Base%20Poke%CC%81mon%20Answers_files/250px-227Skarmory.png)  
Skarmory @Hard Stone (Rock Smash Rocks on Route 111)  
• Sky Attack  
• Fly  
• Steel Wing  
• Rock Tomb/Rock Slide

Sky Attack is an Egg Move and requires you to DexNav for it. Hits EXTREMELY
hard. Fly is a HM. Mainly here for utility and a secondary flying STAB. Steel
Wing is a TM obtained from Steven very early in the game. It provides very
powerful STAB and hits hard. Rock Tomb is a TM obtained from beating Roxanne's
gym in Rustboro City. It gives Skarmory some coverage and does decent damage.
You can eventually teach it Rock Slide. Hard Stone is there to power up its
rock type moves.

Other Potential Flying Types:

![](What%20is%20a%20good%20in-
game%20team%20for%20Omega%20Ruby%20and%20Alpha%20Sapphire%3F%20\(page%203\)%20-%20Poke%CC%81Base%20Poke%CC%81mon%20Answers_files/250px-468Togekiss.png)  
Togekiss  
Obtained as an Egg in Lavaridge Town after beating Primal Kyogre/Groudon. Talk
to the old woman next to the Pokemon Center.  
Moveset  
• Fly  
• Air Slash  
• Aura Sphere  
• Dazzling Gleam

Fly is there purely for the utility. Air Slash and Aura Sphere are learned
after taking Togekiss to the move relearner. Dazzling Gleam is a TM obtained
after talking to a little girl on Route 123. [ This video should help.
](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pNqYfLuXUao)  
It may be a challenge to raise, but once it becomes a Togekiss you better
believe it will put in work.

![](What%20is%20a%20good%20in-
game%20team%20for%20Omega%20Ruby%20and%20Alpha%20Sapphire%3F%20\(page%203\)%20-%20Poke%CC%81Base%20Poke%CC%81mon%20Answers_files/250px-169Crobat.png)  
Crobat  
Obtained in Granite Cave as a Zubat.

Moveset  
• Fly  
• Cross Poison  
• X-Scissor  
• Acrobatics/Brave Bird

Acrobatics hits like a truck without an item, and STAB makes it hit even
harder. It is learned at level 35 by Crobat. Brave Bird is an option, but
requires you to DexNav Zubat, as it is an Egg Move. It comes down to
preference. Cross Poison is a Poison STAB move and is extremely strong. You
must bring Crobat to the move relearner for it to learn Cross Poison.
X-Scissor is there for Coverage. It is a TM obtained in Victory Road. [ This
video should help. ](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pt6F1ync3XU) Fly is there
for the utility and possible second Flying STAB.

**5th Pokemon**  
![](What%20is%20a%20good%20in-
game%20team%20for%20Omega%20Ruby%20and%20Alpha%20Sapphire%3F%20\(page%203\)%20-%20Poke%CC%81Base%20Poke%CC%81mon%20Answers_files/250px-038Ninetales.png)  
Ninetales @Charcoal [ (Location)
](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=i3E7q_E96ZE)  
Obtained as a Vulpix at Mt. Pyre.  
• Flamethrower  
• Nasty Plot  
• Extrasensory  
• Dark Pulse

Flamethrower is learned at level 36 by Vulpix. A must have STAB for any
special fire type, it does its job very well. it is recommended to evolve
Vulpix as soon as it learns this, as you don't miss out on too many good
moves. The Fire Stone is located in the Fiery Path, but requires the use of
Strength. [ This video should help.
](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zibCFfcc3uA) Nasty Plot requires you to
bring Ninetales to the move relearner in order for it to learn it. This move
provides you with a powerful sweeping capability. If you DexNav for a Hidden
Ability Vulpix (Drought) then you have an offensive monster on your team.
Extrasensory is learned at level 31 by Vulpix. This is basic coverage and hits
hard. Dark Pulse is a TM. Even more coverage.

Other Potential Fire Types:

![](What%20is%20a%20good%20in-
game%20team%20for%20Omega%20Ruby%20and%20Alpha%20Sapphire%3F%20\(page%203\)%20-%20Poke%CC%81Base%20Poke%CC%81mon%20Answers_files/250px-219Magcargo.png)  
Macargo @Charcoal  
Located in the Fiery Path as a Slugma.

Moveset  
• Ancient Power  
• Flamethrower  
• Lave Plume  
• Earth Power

Ancient Power is learned by Slugma at level 22. Flamethrower is learned by
Macargo at level 54. It is also a TM in Victory Road. [ This video should
help. ](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xSwbwKZbeVo) Lava Plume is learned by
Slugma at level 34. Earth Power is learned by Macargo at level 58, but is also
an Egg Move. This means you can DexNav for a Slugma that knows Earth Power.

![](What%20is%20a%20good%20in-
game%20team%20for%20Omega%20Ruby%20and%20Alpha%20Sapphire%3F%20\(page%203\)%20-%20Poke%CC%81Base%20Poke%CC%81mon%20Answers_files/250px-323Camerupt.png)  
Camerupt @Charcoal  
Located on Route 112 as a Numel.

Moveset  
• Earth Power  
• Lava Plume  
• Earthquake  
• Rock Slide

Earth Power is learned by Numel at level 26. Lava Plume is learned by Numel at
level 22. Earthquake is learned by Camerupt at level 46. Rock Slide is learned
by Camerupt at level 33.

![](What%20is%20a%20good%20in-
game%20team%20for%20Omega%20Ruby%20and%20Alpha%20Sapphire%3F%20\(page%203\)%20-%20Poke%CC%81Base%20Poke%CC%81mon%20Answers_files/250px-324Torkoal.png)  
Torkoal @Charcoal  
Located in the Fiery Path.

Moveset  
• Heat Wave  
• Sludge Bomb  
• Flame Thrower  
• Earthquake

Heat Wave is learned by Torkoal at level 55. Sludge Bomb is a TM. Flamethrower
is learned by Torkoal at level 28. Earthquake is a TM.

**6th Pokemon**  
Normally, I choose a Pokemon that I really love as the last slot. This time it
was one of my faves,  
![](What%20is%20a%20good%20in-
game%20team%20for%20Omega%20Ruby%20and%20Alpha%20Sapphire%3F%20\(page%203\)%20-%20Poke%CC%81Base%20Poke%CC%81mon%20Answers_files/250px-336Seviper.png)  
Seviper @Life Orb (DexNav Absol and use Thief)  
• Poison Jab  
• Sludge Wave  
• Crunch  
• Coil/Flamethrower

Poison Jab is a strong physical STAB move that is supported by Coil. It hits
so hard and is a great move. It is learned by Seviper at level 34 Sludge Wave
is, in my opion, better for Seviper in-game. The base 100 offenses need all
the boosts they can get. It is a TM located on Route 132\. [ This video should
help. ](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RkxPRnAvKvM) Crunch is good coverage
and really powerful. It is learned by Seviper at level 40. Coil is a great set
up move and is learned at level 46 by Seviper. Flamethrower is a TM that
Seviper can learn, and offers more coverage. It is located in Victory Road. [
This video should help. ](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xSwbwKZbeVo)

And that's it! That was my team in game. I offered some replacements in case
people preferred different mons or wanted more options.

comments.content_original_markup:
Well this is my team for this generation. I really love this team because all of the team member can be obtained so early and its doing very well for me
1. Blaziken - blazikenite-speedboost
- blaze kick
- stone edge
- high jump kick
- protect
For the starter Pokemon I pick one of my favorite Pokemon which is blaziken. This thing is a beast with the ability speed boost when its mega evolve+protect that can protect blaziken for 1 turn and help it to use his ability. Blaze kick and high jump kick for the stab moves while stone edge for type coverage against flying type Pokemon.
2. Gardevoir - gardevoirite/life orb - synchronize
- psychic
- moonblast
- calm mind
- shadow ball
Well my secons team member is gardevoir. You can catch gardevoir first evolution which us ralts at the grass before the petalburg city. Psychic and moonblast for the stab moves, calm mind to raise your gardevoir sp atk so it can one hit ko almost any Pokemon, and shadow ball for type coverage against psychic and shadow ball.
3. Gyarados - intimidate -gyaradosite/mystic water
- waterfall
- dragon dance
- ice fang
- earthquake
One word to describe this Pokemon "BEAST". You can get magikarp at dewford town by using an old rod which also obtained at dewford town. with an amazing 125 base physical attack this thing can easily deal with any Pokemon but keep in mind this Pokemon has low base stat of special attack so I reccomend you not to teach surf / ice beam on gyarados. Waterfall and ice fang for the stab moves, dragon dance for increasing gyarados speed and physical attack and finally my favorite moves which is earthquake for type coverage.
4. Aggron - aggronite - sturdy
- iron head
- surf / aqua tail
- thunder bolt
- earthquake
Every team need a tanker which in my case I choose aggron with and amazing 180 base physical defense. Make sure you use aggron mega evolve because it will make aggron to become pure steel type. You can use surf on aggron because you will need surf through out your game. but, if you want to face the elite four make sure you change surf with aqua tail because aggron spesial attack is not very good. Iron head and earthquake for stab, thunder bolt and aqua tail/surf for type coverage
5. Manectric -manectricite/magnet-lightning rod
- thunder wave/volt switch
- flamethrower
- thunder bolt
- hidden power (ice )
For the electric type I choose manectric. Manectric is very fast so if you want to use volt switch its a good decision but if you dont like it you can change it into thunder wave. Flamethrower and thunder bolt for stab moves, hidden power ice for type coverage against ground type.
6. Altaria - altarianite/pixie plate - natural cure
- fly
- dragon pulse
- moonblast
- flamethrower
Last but not least we have our dragon type Pokemon which is altaria. Altaria is pretty amazing because when its mega evolve altaria will have fairy type on her/his side. I know we already have gardevoir but if your gardevoir us fainted you dont have to worry at all because you have this beast Pokemon for back up. Fly for priority through out the games, dragon pulse and moonblast for type coverage, and finally flamethrower for type coverage against ice type.

comments.content_original_markup:
Same Type Attack Bonus = Bold
= Mega Evolution
Swampert - Brick Break, Surf, Earthquake , Stone Edge (strong physical attacker, good defense) / location: Starter
Slaking - Strength , Aerial Ace, Swagger, Warm Up Punch (extremely high physical attacker, good defense and HP, but have to be wary of ability, was my HM slave until level ~ 30 where I split up HM and he became a valid attacker) / location: Petalburg Woods (before 1st gym)
Camerupt - Flamethrower, Burst Flame, Earthquake , Amnesia (strong attacker both physical and special, but slow and 4x weak to water, needed defensive move) / location: Route 112, Fiery Path, Jagged Pass (before 3rd or 4th gym)
Manectric - Wild Charge, Discharge , Thief, Thunder Wave (high special attack, good speed) / location: Route 110, Route 118 (before 3rd gym, right after slateport)
Gardevoir - Moonblast, Draining Kiss , Magical Leaf, Psychic (very high special attack, has strong fairy moves you can use) / location: Route 102 (where you help wally catch a ralts)
Altaria - Fly, Dragon Pulse , Rock Smash, Aerial Ace (can use HM01, and has dragon type moves. easy dragon type to get) / location : Route 114 and 115 (right after Fallarbor town)

I pride myself with have a team that can attack nearly any type of Pokemon and I try to have a move that exploits all type's weaknesses

Opposing Types-My Move
Normal -Brick Break, Warm Up Punch
Fire - Surf, Earthquake x 2, Stone Edge
Fighting -Fly, Aerial Ace x 2, Psychic, Moonlight, Draining Kiss
Water -Magical Leaf, Discharge, Wild Charge
Flying- Discharge, Wild Charge, Stone Edge
Grass - Fly, Aerial Ace x 2, Flamethrower, Burst Flame
Poison - Psychic, Earthquake x 2
Electric -Earthquake x 2
Ground - Surf, Magical Leaf
Psychic - Thief
Rock - Stone Edge, Magical Leaf, Surf, Earthquake x 2, Brick Break, Warm Up Punch, Rock Smash
Ice - Warm Up Punch, Brick Break, Rock Smash, Flamethrower, Burst Flame,
Bug - Flamethrower, Burst Flame, Aerial Ace x 2, Fly
Dragon - Moonlight, Draining Kiss, Dragon Pulse
Ghost - Thief
Dark - Rock Smash, Warm Up Punch, Brick Break, Moonlight, Draining Kiss
Steel - Rock Smash, Warm Up Punch, Brick Break, Earthquake x 2, Flamethrower, Burst Flame,
Fairy - none :(

Overall I think this is one of my better team because I love exploiting weaknesses and getting that one hit KO. These are all obtained early in game, and if you have a different start, swap them out and change accordingly. Feel free to use as an idea and give me feed back.

HM slave until level ~ 30 where I split up HM and he became a valid attacker)
/ location: Petalburg Woods (before 1st gym)  
Camerupt _- **Flamethrower, Burst Flame, Earthquake** , Amnesia (strong
attacker both physical and special, but slow and 4x weak to water, needed
defensive move) / location: Route 112, Fiery Path, Jagged Pass (before 3rd or
4th gym)  
Manectric _ \- **Wild Charge, Discharge** , Thief, Thunder Wave (high special
attack, good speed) / location: Route 110, Route 118 (before 3rd gym, right
after slateport)  
Gardevoir _- **Moonblast, Draining Kiss** , Magical Leaf, **Psychic** (very
high special attack, has strong fairy moves you can use) / location: Route 102
(where you help wally catch a ralts)  
Altaria _ \- **Fly, Dragon Pulse** , Rock Smash, **Aerial Ace** (can use HM01,
and has dragon type moves. easy dragon type to get) / location : Route 114 and
115 (right after Fallarbor town)

I pride myself with have a team that can attack nearly any type of Pokemon and
I try to have a move that exploits all type's weaknesses

Opposing Types-My Move  
_Normal_ -Brick Break, Warm Up Punch  
_Fire_ \- Surf, Earthquake x 2, Stone Edge  
_Fighting_ -Fly, Aerial Ace x 2, Psychic, Moonlight, Draining Kiss  
_Water_ -Magical Leaf, Discharge, Wild Charge  
_Flying- Discharge, Wild Charge, Stone Edge  
Grass - Fly, Aerial Ace x 2, Flamethrower, Burst Flame  
Poison - Psychic, Earthquake x 2  
Electric -Earthquake x 2  
Ground - Surf, Magical Leaf  
Psychic - Thief  
Rock - Stone Edge, Magical Leaf, Surf, Earthquake x 2, Brick Break, Warm Up
Punch, Rock Smash  
Ice - Warm Up Punch, Brick Break, Rock Smash, Flamethrower, Burst Flame,  
Bug - Flamethrower, Burst Flame, Aerial Ace x 2, Fly  
Dragon - Moonlight, Draining Kiss, Dragon Pulse  
Ghost - Thief  
Dark - Rock Smash, Warm Up Punch, Brick Break, Moonlight, Draining Kiss  
Steel - Rock Smash, Warm Up Punch, Brick Break, Earthquake x 2, Flamethrower,
Burst Flame,  
Fairy _ \- none :(

Overall I think this is one of my better team because I love exploiting
weaknesses and getting that one hit KO. These are all obtained early in game,
and if you have a different start, swap them out and change accordingly. Feel
free to use as an idea and give me feed back.

comments.content_original_markup:
I'll do one for Torchic.

Blaziken @ Blazikenite
Ability: Blaze > Speed Boost
-Blaze Kick / Flare Blitz
-Sky Uppercut / Brick Break
-Earthquake
-Shadow Claw

Blaziken is amazing. Being able to Mega Evolve will come in handy in many situations, especially in the Elite 4.

-Blaze Kick is the reliable STAB attack, but if you want you can swap it for Flare Blitz for extra power.
-Sky Uppercut and Brick Break are both good STAB attacks but you can go with Brick Break if you want 100% accuracy.
-Earthquake is for coverage.
-Shadow Claw is for Psychic Types .

Gardevoir @ Gardevoirite
Ability: Trace > Pixilate
-Psychic
-Moonblast
-Energy Ball
-Calm Mind

You can catch a Ralts early on, on Route 102 . But it will probably take a while.

-Psychic is a powerful STAB.
-Moonblast is the other STAB. It is learned at LV. 62 but it can be obtained via Move Reminder in Fallarbor Town in exchange of one Heart Scale.
-Energy Ball is for the rival's Swampert since we do not have a Grass type.
-Calm Mind is for stat boosting. It's always useful in-game.

Manectric @ Manectite
Ability: Lightning Rod > Intimidate
-Thunderbolt
-Flamethrower
-Thunder Wave
-Volt Switch

Electrike can be found on Route 110. Manectric's electric typing also covers Blaziken's water weakness.

-Thunderbolt is a strong STAB.
-Flamethrower is for coverage.
-Thunder Wave is useful for catching Pokemon.
-Volt Switch helps when a fight goes wrong for Manectric and you neew to switch while dealing some damage.

Absol @ Absolite
Ability: Super Luck > Magic Bounce
-Night Slash
-Psycho Cut
-Sucker Punch
-Swords Dance

Absol can be caught on Route 120, with a small 5% encounter rate. One caught Absol will help a lot against Tate & Liza, and later against Phoebe. With Super Luck, Absol has a 50% critical chance with Night Slash and Psycho Cut.

-Night Slash is for STAB and high crit ratio.
-Psycho Cut is for coverage and again, high crit ratio.
-Sucker Punch is piority for Absol's low base 75 Speed when not Mega Evolved.
-Swords Dance is to boost that outstanding base 130 attack stat.

Walrein @ Never-Melt Ice
Ability: Thick Fat
-Ice Beam
-Surf
-Waterfall
-Body Slam

Walrein is very underrated in my opinion. Great bulk along with Thick Fat make him a great wall.
Spheal/Sealeo can be found in Shoal Cave. Never-Melt Ice can be obtained there too.

-Ice Beam is STAB.
-Surf is a powerful STAB and necessary for the story.
-Waterfall same as Surf
-Body Slam is a good filler move, plus it can paralyze.

Salamence @ Metal Coat
Ability: Intimidate/Moxie
-Dragon Claw
-Earthquake
-Steel Wing
-Crunch

Salamence is a powerhouse. Yes, you get it late but if you have patience it will be very powerful. If you still do not want to go through the hassle of training a Bagon, an alternative would be Flygon.
Flygon is pretty strong, its Ground typing being very useful. The moves I provided for Salamence go very well with Flygon too.

-Dragon Claw is a very strong and reliable STAB
-Earthquake is for coverage
-Steel Wing is coverage agains Fairy and Ice Types
- Crunch is a strong filler move.

comments.content_original_markup:
Swampert @ Soft Sand / Swampertite
Trait - Torrent
Nature - Adamant

  • Earthquake
  • Waterfall
  • Hammer Arm
  • Avalanche / Ice Beam

He is mainly used for earthquake and wont see much action, as the other Pokemons cover all other types.
-With this set you cover: Electric, Fire, Poison, Rock, Steel, Ground, Dark Ice Normal, Dragon Flying and Grass

Breloom @ Coba Berry
Trait - Technician
Nature - Adamant

  • Mach Punch
  • Bullet Seed
  • Rock Tomb
  • Leech Seed

Breloom with techinian is a beast! Its a bit time consuming to get his HA, but its worth the wait. With Mach Punch alone you can take out pretty much everything. Just be carefull of flying types and he will be a very nice addidion.
-With this set you cover: Dark, Ice, Normal, Rock, Steel, Ground, Rock, Water, Bug, Fire and Flying.

Mawile @ Mawilite
Trait - Intimidate -> Huge Power
Nature - Adamant

  • Iron Head
  • Play Rough
  • Crunch
  • Protect

Mega Mawile it amazing, with this set you can take down the entire E4 with Mawile alone. Protect is used on first turn to get the mega safe.
-With this set you cover: Fairy, Ice, Rock, Dark, Dragon, Fight, Ghost and Psychic

I went through Omega Ruby with these 3 mons and did wonderfull. You can use this as a core that you can use to build your team. But if you want you can go throught the game with these mons without problem.

comments.content_original_markup:
4 years later... and here is my team

Swampert
Item: Swampertite
Ability: Torrent (Swift Swim if Mega evolve)
- Waterfall
- Surf
- Earthquake
- Blizzard
Swampert in my opinion is one of the best starter. With good defensive stats and descend offensive stats, Swarmpert could hit hard and also taking damage for the team, with only one weakness, Grass type, which could be easily countered with Blizzard/Ice Beam. Waterfall and Surf are for STAB moves, but also, to use Mega Swampert's 150 Attack stat, with 1 special and 1 physical moves. Earthquake is also for STAB and Blizzard/Ice Beam are for Grass type counter
Gardevoir
Item: King's Rock
Ability: Trace (Pixilate if Mega evolve)
- Psychic
- Dazzling Gleam
- Thunderbolt
- Shadow Ball/Hyper Beam(if you can get Gardevoirite)
Gardevoir is a very good special offensive Pokemon, with both Special attack and defense so high, Gardevoir could hit so hard with STAB moves but also surviving super effective moves on it. Psychic and Dazzling Gleam are for STAB, Thunderbolt is to cover Water weaknesses of the team, and Shadow Ball for countering your Ghost-type weakness
Slaking
Item: Silk Scarf
Ability: Truant
- Giga Impact
- Frustration
- Bulk Up
- Aerial Ace
Slaking, is just OP. Even with Truant, he will still crush other Pokemons with ease. With 160 Attack stat and Giga Impact, which, the recharge and Truant will take place together, will deal massive damage to the enemy. Giga Impact and Frustration is STAB moves,Aerial Ace to deal with Fighting Pokemons, and Bulk Up is just enforcement for Slaking.
Camerupt
Item: Soft Sand
Ability: Solid Rock (Sheer Effect if Mega evolve)
- Flamethrower
- Earthquake
- Sunny Day
- Solarbeam
The reason why I didn't pick Blaziken/Torchic was because of this lava camel. Camerupt is actually one of the best Fire-type Pokemon in Hoenn, with Ground-type will eliminate the weakness to Rock-type moves, but quadruple the weakness to Water-type moves, that's where Sunny Day come in.Flamethrower and Earthquake is STAB moves, Solarbeam would be perfect with Sunny Day to deal with Water-type Pokemon
Altaria
Item: Altarianite
Ability: Natural Cure (Pixilate if Mega evolve)
- Dragon Pulse
- Hyper Beam
- Fly
- Dragon Dance
Yes, Salamence is a much better choice for a Dragon-type Pokemon, but at the time you can catch Bagon, it would be quite late into the game. Flygon is also a good choice, but 3 Ground-type Pokemons in a team is a bit weak to Water-type, since we lack of Electric-type and Grass-type.Dragon Pulse and Fly are for STAB, but once you get the Eon Flute, you could delete Fly, since you won't be needing Fly for any later battles. Hyper Beam with Pixilate will be a 150 power Fairy-type move, which could knock Drako's Salamence down in 1 go.
Walrein
Item: None
Ability: Ice Body
- Strength
- Rock Smash
- Dive
- Hail
This one is just an HM slave that could learn Dive, since Bidoof is not available in ORAS.

comments.content_original_markup:
Pokemon Alpha Sapphire Team- Blaziken, Ludicolo, Manectric, Crobat, Aggron, and Absol

Blaziken-

Moves:
Flamethrower
Sky Uppercut/Hi Jump Kick
Shadow Claw
Earthquake/Stone Edge/Acrobatics

Flamethrower is for your Fire STAB. Sky Uppercut vs. High Jump Kick for physical STAB, depending on whether you prefer safety or power. Shadow Claw for coverage against Psychic type Pokemon, and to help out against Elite Four Phoebe. For the last slot, you can use Earthquake, Stone Edge, or Acrobatics to fill your coverage needs.

Ludicolo-

Moves:
Surf
Energy Ball
Ice Beam
Rain Dance/Focus Blast/Waterfall/Dive

Surf and Energy Ball are STAB. Energy Ball comes kind of late, so you can use Grass Knot until you get it. Ice Beam is coverage and helps out against Elite Four Drake. For the last slot, you can use Rain Dance since it will power up both of Ludicolo's abilities. Focus Blast can be used for additional coverage. Or you can use Waterfall or Dive if you don't want to put those Water HM's on an HM Slave.

Manectric-

Moves:
Thunderbolt
Flamethrower
Volt Switch/Hidden Power
Thunder Wave

Thunderbolt is STAB. Flamethrower is coverage. Manectric's movepool is pretty shallow, so Volt Switch could be a third move if you wanted. Or you could go with Hidden Power if you get a good type, like Ice, Grass, or Water. Thunder Wave is one of the best status moves in the game.

Crobat-

Moves:
Fly
Sludge Bomb/Cross Poison
Toxic
Shadow Ball/Dark Pulse/Steel Wing/Air Slash/X-Scissor/U-Turn/Roost

Fly is very useful for getting around Hoenn, and is a good STAB move. Sludge Bomb or Cross Poison can be used for Crobat's Poison STAB, whichever one you prefer, since the difference between the moves powers and the difference between Crobat's attacking stats makes the moves pretty much interchangeable. Toxic on Crobat is an ideal move since it is very fast and in Gen VI, Toxic will never miss if used by a Poison type Pokemon. For the last slot, you can use Shadow Ball or Dark Pulse if you want to counter Psychic and Ghost Types. Or you can use Steel Wing to counter Rock and Ice types. Air Slash can be used for flinch hax. X-Scissor is another coverage option. U-Turn is a good move for scouting. Roost can also be used if you want a healing option, since Crobat has decent bulk given it's type matchups and resistances.

Aggron-

Moves:
Iron Head
Stone Edge
Earthquake
Dragon Claw/Brick Break/Shadow Claw

Iron Head and Stone Edge are STAB. Earthquake is a coverage move for Aggron. For the last slot, you can use Dragon Claw if Dragons are giving you a hard time. Brick Break is a decent filler move as well. Shadow Claw can be used if you want an extra super effective move on Phoebe.

Absol-

Moves:
Night Slash
Psycho Cut
Swords Dance
Sucker Punch/X-Scissor/Aerial Ace

Night Slash is STAB. Psycho Cut is coverage against Fighting type Pokemon. Swords Dance is to buff Absol's amazing Attack stat. For the last option, you can use Sucker Punch if you want a powerful priority STAB. X-Scissor or Aerial Ace can be used as well if you wanted additional coverage.

comments.content_original_markup:
Pokemon Omega Ruby Team- Sceptile, Swellow, Camerupt, Sharpedo, Pikachu, and Zangoose

Sceptile-

Moves:
Leaf Blade/Energy Ball
Rock Slide/Acrobatics/Hidden Power
Earthquake/Brick Break/Focus Blast
Dragon Claw/Night Slash/Swords Dance/Leaf Storm

Leaf Blade or Energy Ball are for STAB, depending on if you want to go physical or special. Rock Slide, Acrobatics, or Hidden Power can be used for the next coverage move. Earthquake, Brick Break, or Focus Blast can also be nice coverage for Sceptile, especially against Steel types. In the last moveslot, Dragon Claw is a good move to have, as Mega Sceptile is part Dragon. Night Slash can also be a nifty move to have, especially for Elite Four Phoebe. Swords Dance could also be an option, since Sceptile has a good Attack stat and it's physical movepool is much bigger than it's special movepool. Leaf Storm can be an incredibly good finisher, especially since Sceptile has a stellar Special Attack stat.

Swellow-

Moves:
Fly
Facade/Return
Steel Wing
Aerial Ace/Air Slash/Brave Bird/U-Turn/Roost

Fly is STAB, and really helpful in the field. Facade or Return can be used for STAB, keep in mind that Facade's power will indeed stack with Swellow's ability, Guts. Steel Wing is a good coverage move, taking care of Ice, Rock, and Fairy types. For the last moveslot, you can go with Aerial Ace for convenience, Air Slash for flinches, Brave Bird for power, U-Turn for scouting, or Roost for recovery.

Camerupt-

Moves:
Flamethrower
Earthquake/Earth Power
Stone Edge
Flash Cannon/Eruption/Explosion

Flamethrower is STAB. You can use Earthquake or Earth Power for Ground STAB depending on if you want a physical or special attacking Ground move. Stone Edge is a really good move that forms the "EdgeQuake" combo, a combo that has amazing neutral coverage. For the last move, you can use Flash Cannon if you are worried about Fairy types. Otherwise, you can go with Eruption for raw power, or Explosion as a final stand.

Sharpedo-

Moves:
Surf
Crunch/Night Slash/Dark Pulse
Ice Beam/Fang
Waterfall/Dive/Poison Fang/Poison Jab/Scald/Aqua Jet

Surf is STAB, and extremely necessary in Hoenn, which is as watery as it was in Generation III. Crunch, Night Slash, or Dark Pulse can be used for Dark type STAB. Ice Beam or Ice Fang can be used for coverage. For the last move, Waterfall is a pretty good move since Sharpedo has a really high Attack stat, and Waterfall is a physical move in the Ruby/Sapphire remakes. Dive could also be used if you want. Poison Fang or Poison Jab can be used to counter Fairies. Scald can be used if you want to play around with a chance of burning the opponent. Aqua Jet is a good priority move, and can be pretty nice to have.

Pikachu-

Moves:
Thunderbolt
Wild Charge/Charge Beam/Volt Switch
Brick Break/Grass Knot/Hidden Power
Thunder Wave

If you are wondering why it says Pikachu instead of Raichu, it's because the Light Ball is extremely easy to find in ORAS. With the Light Ball, Pikachu hits as hard as Legendary Pokemon! Plus, I like Pikachu a lot more than Raichu, so that's what I'm recommending. Thunderbolt is STAB. Wild Charge or Volt Switch can be used for secondary STAB, or you can go with Charge Beam to buff up even more. For coverage, you can use Brick Break, Grass Knot, or Hidden Power (Water or Ice ideally). Thunder Wave rounds out the set since it is a phenominal status move, one of, if not the best, in the entire game.

Zangoose-

Moves:
Return
Shadow Claw
Close Combat
Swords Dance/X-Scissor/Aerial Ace/Poison Jab

Return is STAB. Shadow Claw and Close Combat, combined provide excellent neutral coverage. For the last move, Swords Dance is a great option to buff Zangoose's amazing physical Attack stat. X-Scissor, Aerial Ace, or Poison Jab can be used as additonal coverage options if you want.

Swampet @ Swamperite
Ability torrent (swift swim when mega)
Moves: Earthquake - Learns at level 51 or Buy at the slateport market or do to pacifidog town inside one of the houses
rock slide - Learns as a marshtomp at level 28
Surf - HM MOVE (optional)
Waterfall - HM MOVE (Great on swampert)


Vileplume @ Who knows...
ability: chlorophyll
Moves:
Toxic - Learns at level 39 as a gloom or by TM
sleep powder - Great for catching Pokemon and annoying people online and making battles slightly easier
giga drain - Learns at level 34 as a gloom
Moonlight - Good move online and great if you have no potions

you can also use petal dance but it learns it at level 54 so be patient....


Camerupt @ Cameruptite (POST GAME! TRY SOMETHING ELSE LIKE SOMETHING THAT POWERS UP FIRE MOVES LIKE THE FIRE GEMS)
ability: solid rock
Moves: Fissure - It is a move really just for fun so feel free to use it or not, Learns at level 59
Lava plume - Great for doubles, Learns as a numel at level 22
Rock slide - Learns at level 33 (swampet already has it so maybe you want to use a different move like flash cannon)
Earthquake - Essential for this Pokemon.... learns at level 46


Grumpig @ Cheri berry (IDK!)
ability: own tempo
May seem like an odd choice but its psychics are awesome and its great if you can't get an alakazam because you have no friends :D
Moves: Teeter dance - Good for confusion, can't remember when it learns it....
Psychic - An obvious choice, learns at level 52, its fine if you just use psyshock at level 42
Power gem - Good for flying and ice types, learns at level 35
Shadow ball - Good for countering its own type and dark and ghost, learns as a TM

At level 60, it learns bounce (which is at post game) so you may want to replace teeter dance for bounc


Altaria @ Altarianite (idk if it is post game so stick with either gems, focus sash or berrys or whatever!)
Ability: Natural cure
Definitly not as strong as salamance or flygon but its so cute and fluffy and it has some of the better bulk out of the 2
Moves: Disarming voice - Never misses, perfect for double battles, Should be on a swablu as soon as your catch it
Dragon pulse - Learns at level 40, great move even if altarias attack is awful
Cotton guard (learns as a swablu) - Learns at level 34, my altaria has earthquake on it (because aparently I did not care about phsycial and special) so I don't want you to make the mistake so go for cotton guard so altaria is unkillable!
Moonblast - better for singles and more power though has a chance to miss. learns at level 52

Last but not least....
LINOONE @ none
ability: pickup
I did not use linoone much as a hm slave, only for stength, I has another linoone which was for hm slave
moves: Pin missle - Not a great attack since it can miss but its great against types it is weak against.. learns as a zigzagoon at level 19
belly drum - AWESOME MOVE, LETS PIN MISSLE 1-2 SHOT POKEMON, DOUBLE EDGE AND STRENGTH ARE OP AWESOME MOVE! Learns at level 43
Double edge - Learns at level 35
strength - HM MOVE, Great for obsticals that require a hm move...

comments.content_original_markup:
No words. Let's just get this team started!

Blaziken@Blazikenite
-Flare Blitz
-High Jump Kick
-Brave Bird
-Earthquake

Blaziken is a Pokemon with good stats, a good typing, and a good design. It is just an amazing Pokemon overall. It can be found on Route 1 as your starter. Blaziken can learn Flare Blitz and High Jump Kick at level 1 and they are two STAB moves with incredible power. Brave Bird is a good coverage move for Blaziken in general for killing Bug,Fighting, and Grass-type Pokemon. You're probably going to say that Flare Blitz can also defeat Bug and Grass-type Pokemon. But, can it defeat Fighting types for super effective damage? It is learned at level 50. And Earthquake is just a filler pretty much and can be found as a TM in the Cave of Origin near Sootopolis City.

Gardevoir@Gardevoirite
-Moonblast
-Psychic
-Thunderbolt
-Shadow Ball

Gardevoir is just one of my favorite Pokemon overall. It can be found on Route 102 past Oldale Town. Now let me tell you that Psychic-Fairy is pretty much an unstoppable typing with almost no weaknesses except for Ghost, Steel, and Poison. Moonblast is learned at level 1 and is a great STAB Fairy-type move. Psychic is a great Psychic-type STAB move and can be learned once you hit level 30 for Kirlia (which is the level it evolves) or it can be learned at level 31 as a Gardevoir. Thunderbolt is a good filler move, which can be found at Mauville Hills after the New Mauville events. And Shadow Ball is a coverage TM that can be found at the top of Mt.Pyre.

Roserade@Miracle Seed
-Energy Ball
-Sludge Bomb
-Dazzling Gleam
-Shadow Ball

Roserade is a nice Grass/Poison-type Pokemon like Venuaur but it doesn't have the 530-ish base stats of Venusaur or the Mega-Evolution. It can be found on Route 117 as a Roselia. It is only 1 out of 3 Pokemon with a "unique evolution" on this team by evolving it with a Shiny Stone that can be found on Route 123. Energy Ball is a TM you can get in the Safari Zone, but you need to have both the Acro Bike and the Mach Bike to do so. Also, another team member can be found at the Safari Zone later on. Sludge Bomb is a TM that can be found at Dewford Town at the largest house by talking to a Pokemon Collector. Dazzling Gleam is a TM you can get on the other side of Route 123 by defeating a Fairy-Tale Girl. And Shadow Ball again is a TM that can be found at the top of Mt.Pyre.

Altaria@Altarianite
-Dragon Pulse
-Moonblast
-Flamethrower
-Fly

Altaria is a nice FLUFFY CLOUD BIRD. It can be found as a little Swablu on Route 119 near Meteor Falls. Dragon Pulse is a STAB move that can be learned at level 40. Moonblast is a coverage move to get over its Dragon weakness. But if it is a Mega Altaria it is a STAB move. Flamethrower is a TM that is coverage against Ice-Types and can be found at Victory Road. And Fly is an HM you get at Route 119 from your rival which is STAB and another team member can be found on Route 119 right after this one. You might be like AHHHH there is a big Poison-Type weakness but Gardevoir's Psychic can get over that.

Milotic@Mystic Water
-Surf
-Ice Beam
-Dive
-Waterfall

Milotic is such a drop-dead gorgeous Pokemon ( but I prefer another Water beauty more than it). It can be found on Route 119 as a Feebas by fishing. It has 2 "unique evolutions" because you can trade a Feebas holding a Prism Scale or you can use Pokeblocks to max out its Beauty stat. DO NOT TRADE IT USING A PRISM SCALE! Just evolve it using Pokeblocks. Surf is a STAB HM that can be found in Petalburg City from Wally's Uncle after defeating Norman. Ice Beam is a coverage TM that can be found at Sea Mauville. Dive is a STAB HM that can be found at Mossdeep City in the Drought/Drizzle scene. And Waterfall is a STAB HM that can be found at the Sootopolis City gym after defeating the Gym-Leader Wallace.

Lopunnny@Lopunnite
-Return
-High Jump Kick
-Ice Beam/Punch
-Strength

Lopunny is one of the Pokemon I hold dearly to my heart. The moment I saw it I instantly fell in love with it because it is soooooo Kawaii-Desu or cute. It can be found in the Safari Zone on Route 121 after getting the national dex from Prof. Birch after the battle between you and Kyogre/Groudon. It has a " unique evolution" because it evolves with high friendship, so I suggest getting a Soothe Bell because it'll do the trick. Return is a STAB move that can be learned at level 1 or as a TM in Pacifidlog Town in Post-Game but we don't want to get it so late so just teach it via move relearner. High Jump Kick is a STAB move for Mega-Lopunny that can be learned on level 66 but just go to the move relearner for it too. Ice Beam is a coverage move for Mega-Lopunny for it's flying weakness that's a TM that can be found at Sea Mauville. You might be like Lopunny isn't a special attacker but I don't wanna put Ice Punch on it because it is an egg move but I know you can get that move via DexNav so you can put it on if you want. And Strength is a HM that can be found at Route 112 given to you by your rival.

So, that's my team I hope you like it! Omega Ruby and Alpha Sapphire are amazing games and I got Alpha Sapphire just recently because I have been living under a rock all this time (It's a joke I don't live under a rock really). Again, hope you liked my team. Byeeeeeeeeeeeeeeee!
P.S. Sorry for no pics!

Please read the following guidelines before posting an answer here:

  • Please include (at least) six Pokemon in your answer , each with a specified set of moves . Abilities, natures, items and especially EVs are helpful but not a necessity.

  • Be mindful that players may not be able to get certain Pokemon, such as those restricted by version exclusivity or a trade evolution. If you'd like to suggest one of these, be sure to mention alternative/s .

  • Please also be considerate that many players have particular rule-sets for teams , such as to disallow overpowered legendary Pokemon or keep the starter on the team. You're welcome to suggest otherwise, but again it is kind to mention other options.

  • Please provide ample explanation .
question.content_text:
Please read the following **guidelines** before posting an answer here:

  * Please include (at least) **six Pokemon in your answer** , each with a specified set of **moves** . Abilities, natures, items and especially EVs are helpful but not a necessity. 

  * Be mindful that players may not be able to get certain Pokemon, such as those restricted by version exclusivity or a trade evolution. If you'd like to suggest one of these, be sure to **mention alternative/s** . 

  * Please also be considerate that many players have particular **rule-sets for teams** , such as to disallow overpowered legendary Pokemon or keep the starter on the team. You're welcome to suggest otherwise, but again it is kind to mention other options. 

  * Please provide ample **explanation** .
